label: 松永尺五
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (1592-1657) [Scholar and teacher in Kyoto.] Among the most distinguished of Sekigo's five thousand followers" were Kinoshita Jun'an, the most influential teacher of his generation, and the commoner Itō Jinsai who, with his son Tōgai, attracted large numbers of students (pp. 724-725). [木下順庵、伊藤仁斎、伊藤東涯]"
